https://jenkins.openbmc.org/job/ci-repository/88337/ : FAILURE
Let's send these to phosphor-logging instead of using the journal.  Even if it is an arbitrary message to phosphor-logging, I'd rather see them there.
Modified the commit message. We did send event message to both on D-Bus and journal. Would like to ask if we leaves the phosphor-logging only.
Support for this should be broken out into a separate commit, as it should be trivial to get merged.
Done. Changed this to https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/pldm/+/69869.
I'm a bit surprised we need this.  I don't like having separate code paths that are only even compiled under certain configs.
Done

I think there was some confusion on this comment because now the meson option seems to be completely gone.

- I really don't want to see arbitrary files with `#ifdef OEM_META`.  We already have way too much `#ifdef OEM_IBM` sprinkled around and we shouldn't make this worse.

- We _should_ be able to disable the oem/meta subdirectory for community members that don't want it.  This is where the meson.option comes into use.  We can add full source parts or remove full source parts as long as by default the CI has `oem-meta=enabled`.
I don't know if this got removed in some rebase with another commit or what, but we do want to keep this option.
Get this from the phosphor-dbus-interfaces header.
Done
How would we handle machines with a different DIMM labeling scheme?  (Not an ifdef I hope).
Is there any other case we can reference to?

I guess Halfdome appears to have been the last system with more than 8 channels.  It does appear that they are still letters, but they are somewhat random in arrangement:

A B D C H G E F
Done. Thank you the example.
Why is this function named `get...Number` if it returns a string?
Chenged to getSlotNumberString.
Why forward declare?
Done
auto response = ...
Done
Let's not do this.  The lg2 already puts the function name in the journal.
Done

I'm surprised this code doesn't need the service name.  It looks like inside this function it calls mapper to get the service name.  So that means we've got two calls to mapper to basically get a single property.

We should probably follow up with an improvement here.
Acknowledged
Please name these and use `enum class` rather than creating an anonymous enum.
Done
`static constexpr auto memoryError = std::to_array(...`
Done
I don't think any of these need to be in this header?
Done
Is there any way we can do this without an ifdef?  Can we have the handlers somehow register with the manager instead of having specific functions in the manager for each message?

Done. We made the code change for check the EM config for IANA before getting into OEM command handler.
https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/entity-manager/+/69876
Won't this fail to compile on non-Meta compiles?
Done
Don't use C-style struct definitions.  `struct dimm_info`
Don't use _ prefixes.
Any reason these can't be `size_t` by the time we get to using it here?  I understand it comes from PLDM as a uint8_t, but we can turn it into an index quickly, right?
Why isn't this taking a `const dimm_info&`?
Maybe add an `invalid location` constant?
We have a lot of string concatenation through out this whole commit.  Would it be clearer to use std::format instead?
Why do we need to mask these?  Isn't this just hiding potential data problems and limiting the hardware size to the Yv4 design?  Seems like convertToDimmString already has index checking.

We should be able to eliminate this variable.  By using a local variable you're potentially making it so the compiler can't use Return-Value-Optimization (RVO) and it isn't really providing any clarity or code simplicity (see later comments in this function).
This is kind of silly, isn't it?  We've used a variable and then also documented the expected default value of the variable?  Just `return "Unknown"`?
Return it here?  Why keep going?
You don't need to use `what` on any lg2 calls.
lg2 already inserts the source-location information.  Please don't add it manually also.

I'm very afraid.

We have a buffer and a size.  We never look at the size variable?  How do you know you've not overflowed the buffer?
We should get this to be a typedef somewhere since it seems to be a regularly used type for PLDM handlers, right?
nit: auto?  (Can be done throughout a lot of this code)
Why is 0 x86?  Need a constant here?

nit:

I would generally prefer to see this as:

```
auto [dimmLocation, dimm] = getCommonDimmLocation(dimmInfo)
```

This would require getCommonDimmLocation to return a `std::tuple<std::string, std::string>`.
Why is plat 0 Intel here but x86 earlier?
Any time you're casting from an enumeration type here, you should really be using `std::to_underlying` instead.  Please fix these throughout.
This seems to be the only difference?  Can we improve the Intel BIC code to leave this field as zeros?

We need to come up with some kind of IANA registration system so that code can register as "I handle these IANA events", just like we do for the OEM handlers.

We should not need to come up with independent functions like this for each OEM event.
nit: IANA (this is an acronym)
I'm quite confused how we ended up with a `*Meta*` function in a non-Meta file.
Do we need any tests for the code we've written?  There is a lot of code in this commit for not having a single test case to go with it.
